page.title: 09THE NEW BRIDGE AT BOLTON
page.content: The bridge is at{Furlong Road,}Bolton. The old bridge was about 90 years old and developed downward fractures. The 125 trains were too heavy for it because it was build for lighter trains. The works department of the railway board at Sheffield are responsible for the new bridge with some sub-contractors. The bridge has expansion gaps in the centre part which weighs about{350 tonnes}and is made of prefabricated reinforced concrete blocks. Fitters, joiners, plasterers and all sorts of construction machinery have been used. Rail-traffic was only stopped for about two days during construction but single lane road traffic has operated many times during the{thirteen months} it has taken to build the bridge. The slopes at the side of the bridge are being landscaped by Harrisons.
